Name: Acrobatics
Effect: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item this attack inflicts massive damage.

Name: Aerial Ace
Effect: The user confounds the target with speed then slashes. The attack lands without fail.

Name: Aqua Jet
Effect: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. It is sure to strike first.

Name: Aqua Tail
Effect: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.

Name: Arm Thrust
Effect: The user looses a flurry of open-palmed arm thrusts that hit two to five times in a row.

Name: Assurance
Effect: If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn this attack's power is doubled.

Name: Astonish
Effect: The user attacks the target while shouting in a startling fashion. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Attack Order
Effect: The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Avalanche
Effect: An attack move that inflicts double the damage if the user has been hurt by the target in the same turn.

Name: Barrage
Effect: Round objects are hurled at the target to strike two to five times in a row.

Name: Beat Up
Effect: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon the greater the number of attacks.

Name: Bide
Effect: The user endures attacks for two turns then strikes back to cause double the damage taken.

Name: Bind
Effect: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.

Name: Bite
Effect: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. It may make the target flinch.

Name: Blaze Kick
Effect: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Body Slam
Effect: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Bolt Strike
Effect: The user charges its target surrounding itself with a great amount of electricity. It may leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Bone Club
Effect: The user clubs the target with a bone. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Bone Rush
Effect: The user strikes the target with a hard bone two to five times in a row.

Name: Bonemerang
Effect: The user throws the bone it holds. The bone loops to hit the target twice coming and going.

Name: Bounce
Effect: The user bounces up high then drops on the target on the second turn. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Brave Bird
Effect: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. The user also takes serious damage.

Name: Brick Break
Effect: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break any barrier such as Light Screen and Reflect.

Name: Bug Bite
Effect: The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry the user eats it and gains its effect.

Name: Bulldoze
Effect: The user stomps down on the ground and attacks everything in the area. Hit Pokémon's Speed stat is reduced.

Name: Bullet Punch
Effect: The user strikes the target with tough punches as fast as bullets. This move always goes first.

Name: Bullet Seed
Effect: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target. Two to five seeds are shot in rapid succession.

Name: Chip Away
Effect: Looking for an opening the user strikes continually. The target's stat changes don't affect this attack's damage.

Name: Circle Throw
Effect: The user throws the target and drags out another Pokémon in its party. In the wild the battle ends.

Name: Clamp
Effect: The target is clamped and squeezed by the user's very thick and sturdy shell for four to five turns.

Name: Close Combat
Effect: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. It also cuts the user's Defense and Sp. Def.

Name: Comet Punch
Effect: The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike two to five times in a row.

Name: Constrict
Effect: The target is attacked with long creeping tentacles or vines. It may also lower the target's Speed stat.

Name: Counter
Effect: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack inflicting double the damage taken.

Name: Covet
Effect: The user endearingly approaches the target then steals the target's held item.

Name: Crabhammer
Effect: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Cross Chop
Effect: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Cross Poison
Effect: A slashing attack with a poisonous blade that may also leave the target poisoned. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Crunch
Effect: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. It may also lower the target's Defense stat.

Name: Crush Claw
Effect: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. It may also lower the target's Defense.

Name: Crush Grip
Effect: The target is crushed with great force. The attack is more powerful the more HP the target has left.

Name: Cut
Effect: The target is cut with a scythe or a claw. It can also be used to cut down thin trees.

Name: Diamond Storm
Effect: The user whips up a storm of diamonds to damage opposing Pokémon. This may also raise the user's Defense stat.

Name: Dig
Effect: The user burrows then attacks on the second turn. It can also be used to exit dungeons.

Name: Dive
Effect: Diving on the first turn the user floats up and attacks on the second turn. It can be used to dive deep in the ocean.

Name: Dizzy Punch
Effect: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches that may also leave it confused.

Name: Double Hit
Effect: The user slams the target with a long tail vines or tentacle. The target is hit twice in a row.

Name: Double Kick
Effect: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.

Name: Double Slap
Effect: The target is slapped repeatedly back and forth two to five times in a row.

Name: Double-Edge
Effect: A reckless life-risking tackle. It also damages the user by a fairly large amount however.

Name: Dragon Ascent
Effect: After soaring upward the user attacks its target by dropping out of the sky at high speeds although it lowers its own Defense and Sp. Def in the process.

Name: Dragon Claw
Effect: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

Name: Dragon Rush
Effect: The user tackles the target while exhibiting overwhelming menace. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Dragon Tail
Effect: The user knocks away the target and drags out another Pokémon in its party. In the wild the battle ends.

Name: Drain Punch
Effect: An energy-draining punch. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Drill Peck
Effect: A corkscrewing attack with the sharp beak acting as a drill.

Name: Drill Run
Effect: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Dual Chop
Effect: The user attacks its target by hitting it with brutal strikes. The target is hit twice in a row.

Name: Dynamic Punch
Effect: The user punches the target with full concentrated power. It confuses the target if it hits.

Name: Earthquake
Effect: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes those around it.

Name: Egg Bomb
Effect: A large egg is hurled at the target with maximum force to inflict damage.

Name: Endeavor
Effect: An attack move that cuts down the target's HP to equal the user's HP.

Name: Explosion
Effect: The user explodes to inflict damage on those around it. The user faints upon using this move.

Name: Extreme Speed
Effect: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This attack always goes before any other move.

Name: Facade
Effect: An attack move that doubles its power if the user is poisoned burned or has paralysis.

Name: Fake Out
Effect: An attack that hits first and makes the target flinch. It only works the first turn the user is in battle.

Name: False Swipe
Effect: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.

Name: Feint
Effect: An attack that hits a target using Protect or Detect. It also lifts the effects of those moves.

Name: Feint Attack
Effect: The user approaches the target disarmingly then throws a sucker punch. It hits without fail.

Name: Fell Stinger
Effect: When the user knocks out a target with this move the user's Attack stat rises sharply.

Name: Fire Fang
Effect: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. It may also make the target flinch or leave it burned.

Name: Fire Punch
Effect: The target is punched with a fiery fist. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Fissure
Effect: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. The target instantly faints if it hits.

Name: Flail
Effect: The user flails about aimlessly to attack. It becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.

Name: Flame Charge
Effect: The user cloaks itself with flame and attacks. Building up more power it raises the user's Speed stat.

Name: Flame Wheel
Effect: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Flare Blitz
Effect: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. The user sustains serious damage and may leave the target burned.

Name: Fling
Effect: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. Its power and effects depend on the item.

Name: Fly
Effect: The user soars then strikes its target on the second turn. It can also be used for flying to any familiar town.

Name: Flying Press
Effect: The user dives down onto the target from the sky. This move is Fighting and Flying type simultaneously.

Name: Focus Punch
Effect: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. It will fail if the user is hit before it is used.

Name: Force Palm
Effect: The target is attacked with a shock wave. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Foul Play
Effect: The user turns the target's power against it. The higher the target's Attack stat the greater the damage.

Name: Freeze Shock
Effect: On the second turn the user hits the target with electrically charged ice. It may leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Frustration
Effect: A full-power attack that grows more powerful the less the user likes its Trainer.

Name: Fury Attack
Effect: The target is jabbed repeatedly with a horn or beak two to five times in a row.

Name: Fury Cutter
Effect: The target is slashed with scythes or claws. Its power increases if it hits in succession.

Name: Fury Swipes
Effect: The target is raked with sharp claws or scythes for two to five times in quick succession.

Name: Fusion Bolt
Effect: The user throws down a giant thunderbolt. This attack does greater damage when influenced by an enormous flame.

Name: Gear Grind
Effect: The user attacks by throwing two steel gears at its target.

Name: Giga Impact
Effect: The user charges at the target using every bit of its power. The user must rest on the next turn.

Name: Guillotine
Effect: A vicious tearing attack with big pincers. The target will faint instantly if this attack hits.

Name: Gunk Shot
Effect: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to attack. It may also poison the target.

Name: Gyro Ball
Effect: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user the greater the damage.

Name: Hammer Arm
Effect: The user swings and hits with its strong and heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed however.

Name: Head Charge
Effect: The user charges its head into its target using its powerful guard hair. It also damages the user a little.

Name: Head Smash
Effect: The user attacks the target with a hazardous full-power headbutt. The user also takes terrible damage.

Name: Headbutt
Effect: The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging straight into the target. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Heart Stamp
Effect: The user unleashes a vicious blow after its cute act makes the target less wary. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Heat Crash
Effect: The user slams its target with its flame- covered body. The more the user outweighs the target the greater the damage.

Name: Heavy Slam
Effect: The user slams into the target with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target the greater its damage.

Name: High Jump Kick
Effect: The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump. If it misses the user is hurt instead.

Name: Hold Back
Effect: The user holds back when it attacks and the target is left with at least 1 HP.

Name: Horn Attack
Effect: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to inflict damage.

Name: Horn Drill
Effect: The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a drill. If it hits the target faints instantly.

Name: Horn Leech
Effect: The user drains the target's energy with its horns. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Hyper Fang
Effect: The user bites hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Hyperspace Fury
Effect: Using its many arms the user unleashes a barrage of attacks that ignore the effects of moves like Protect and Detect. This attack lowers the user's Defense.

Name: Ice Ball
Effect: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes stronger each time it hits.

Name: Ice Fang
Effect: The user bites with cold-infused fangs. It may also make the target flinch or leave it frozen.

Name: Ice Punch
Effect: The target is punched with an icy fist. It may also leave the target frozen.

Name: Ice Shard
Effect: The user flash freezes chunks of ice and hurls them at the target. This move always goes first.

Name: Icicle Crash
Effect: The user attacks by harshly dropping an icicle onto the target. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Icicle Spear
Effect: The user launches sharp icicles at the target. It strikes two to five times in a row.

Name: Iron Head
Effect: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Iron Tail
Effect: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. It may also lower the target's Defense stat.

Name: Jump Kick
Effect: The user jumps up high then strikes with a kick. If the kick misses the user hurts itself.

Name: Karate Chop
Effect: The target is attacked with a sharp chop. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Knock Off
Effect: The user slaps down the target's held item preventing that item from being used in the battle.

Name: Land's Wrath
Effect: The user gathers the energy of the land and focuses that power on opposing Pokémon to damage them.

Name: Last Resort
Effect: This move can be used only after the user has used all the other moves it knows in the battle.

Name: Leaf Blade
Effect: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and attacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Leech Life
Effect: The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Lick
Effect: The target is licked with a long tongue causing damage. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Low Kick
Effect: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. It inflicts greater damage on heavier targets.

Name: Low Sweep
Effect: The user attacks the target's legs swiftly reducing the target's Speed stat.

Name: Mach Punch
Effect: The user throws a punch at blinding speed. It is certain to strike first.

Name: Magnet Bomb
Effect: The user launches steel bombs that stick to the target. This attack will not miss.

Name: Magnitude
Effect: The user looses a ground-shaking quake affecting everyone around the user. Its power varies.

Name: Mega Kick
Effect: The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-packed power.

Name: Mega Punch
Effect: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.

Name: Megahorn
Effect: Using its tough and impressive horn the user rams into the target with no letup.

Name: Metal Burst
Effect: The user retaliates with much greater power against the target that last inflicted damage on it.

Name: Metal Claw
Effect: The target is raked with steel claws. It may also raise the user's Attack stat.

Name: Meteor Mash
Effect: The target is hit with a hard punch fired like a meteor. It may also raise the user's Attack.

Name: Natural Gift
Effect: The user draws power to attack by using its held Berry. The Berry determines its type and power.

Name: Needle Arm
Effect: The user attacks by wildly swinging its thorny arms. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Night Slash
Effect: The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Nuzzle
Effect: The user attacks by nuzzling its electrified cheeks against the target. This also leaves the target with paralysis.

Name: Outrage
Effect: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. It then becomes confused however.

Name: Pay Day
Effect: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.

Name: Payback
Effect: If the user moves after the target this attack's power will be doubled.

Name: Peck
Effect: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed beak or horn.

Name: Petal Blizzard
Effect: The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard and attacks everything around it.

Name: Phantom Force
Effect: The user vanishes somewhere then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.

Name: Pin Missile
Effect: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

Name: Play Rough
Effect: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target's Attack stat.

Name: Pluck
Effect: The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry the user eats it and gains its effect.

Name: Poison Fang
Effect: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. It may also leave the target badly poisoned.

Name: Poison Jab
Effect: The target is stabbed with a tentacle or arm steeped in poison. It may also poison the target.

Name: Poison Sting
Effect: The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger. This may also poison the target.

Name: Poison Tail
Effect: The user hits the target with its tail. It may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Pound
Effect: The target is physically pounded with a long tail or a foreleg etc.

Name: Power Whip
Effect: The user violently whirls its vines or tentacles to harshly lash the target.

Name: Power-Up Punch
Effect: Striking opponents over and over makes the user's fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

Name: Precipice Blades
Effect: The user attacks opposing Pokémon by manifesting the power of the land in fearsome blades of stone.

Name: Present
Effect: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. It restores HP sometimes however.

Name: Psycho Cut
Effect: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Punishment
Effect: This attack's power increases the more the target has powered up with stat changes.

Name: Pursuit
Effect: An attack move that inflicts double damage if used on a target that is switching out of battle.

Name: Quick Attack
Effect: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. It is sure to strike first.

Name: Rage
Effect: As long as this move is in use the power of rage raises the Attack stat each time the user is hit in battle.

Name: Rapid Spin
Effect: A spin attack that can also eliminate such moves as Bind Wrap Leech Seed and Spikes.

Name: Razor Leaf
Effect: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at the opposing team. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Razor Shell
Effect: The user cuts its target with sharp shells. This attack may also lower the target's Defense stat.

Name: Retaliate
Effect: The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally fainted in the previous turn this attack's damage increases.

Name: Return
Effect: A full-power attack that grows more powerful the more the user likes its Trainer.

Name: Revenge
Effect: An attack move that inflicts double the damage if the user has been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.

Name: Reversal
Effect: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.

Name: Rock Blast
Effect: The user hurls hard rocks at the target. Two to five rocks are launched in quick succession.

Name: Rock Climb
Effect: The user attacks the target by smashing into it with incredible force. It may also confuse the target.

Name: Rock Slide
Effect: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing team to inflict damage. It may also make the targets flinch.

Name: Rock Smash
Effect: The user attacks with a punch that can shatter a rock. It may also lower the target's Defense stat.

Name: Rock Throw
Effect: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to attack.

Name: Rock Tomb
Effect: Boulders are hurled at the target. It also lowers the target's Speed by preventing its movement.

Name: Rock Wrecker
Effect: The user launches a huge boulder at the target to attack. It must rest on the next turn however.

Name: Rolling Kick
Effect: The user lashes out with a quick spinning kick. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Rollout
Effect: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes stronger each time it hits.

Name: Sacred Fire
Effect: The target is razed with a mystical fire of great intensity. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Sacred Sword
Effect: The user attacks by slicing with its long horns. The target's stat changes don't affect this attack's damage.

Name: Sand Tomb
Effect: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm for four to five turns.

Name: Scratch
Effect: Hard pointed and sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.

Name: Secret Power
Effect: The user attacks the target with a secret power. Its added effects vary depending on the user's environment.

Name: Seed Bomb
Effect: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.

Name: Seismic Toss
Effect: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user's level.

Name: Self-Destruct
Effect: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this move.

Name: Shadow Claw
Effect: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Shadow Force
Effect: The user disappears then strikes the target on the second turn. It hits even if the target protects itself.

Name: Shadow Punch
Effect: The user throws a punch from the shadows. The punch lands without fail.

Name: Shadow Sneak
Effect: The user extends its shadow and attacks the target from behind. This move always goes first.

Name: Skull Bash
Effect: The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense in the first turn then rams the target on the next turn.

Name: Sky Attack
Effect: A second-turn attack move where critical hits land more easily. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Sky Drop
Effect: The user takes the target into the sky then drops it during the next turn. The target cannot attack while in the sky.

Name: Sky Uppercut
Effect: The user attacks the target with an uppercut thrown skyward with force.

Name: Slam
Effect: The target is slammed with a long tail vines etc. to inflict damage.

Name: Slash
Effect: The target is attacked with a slash of claws or blades. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Smack Down
Effect: The user throws a stone or projectile to attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon will fall to the ground when hit.

Name: Smelling Salts
Effect: This attack inflicts double damage on a target with paralysis. It also cures the target's paralysis however.

Name: Spark
Effect: The user throws an electrically charged tackle at the target. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Spike Cannon
Effect: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

Name: Steamroller
Effect: The user crushes its targets by rolling over them with its rolled-up body. This attack may make the target flinch.

Name: Steel Wing
Effect: The target is hit with wings of steel. It may also raise the user's Defense stat.

Name: Stomp
Effect: The target is stomped with a big foot. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Stone Edge
Effect: The user stabs the foe with sharpened stones from below. It has a high critical-hit ratio.

Name: Storm Throw
Effect: The user strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.

Name: Strength
Effect: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power. It can also be used to move heavy boulders.

Name: Struggle
Effect: An attack that is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. It also hurts the user slightly.

Name: Submission
Effect: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. It also hurts the user slightly.

Name: Sucker Punch
Effect: This move enables the user to attack first. It fails if the target is not readying an attack however.

Name: Super Fang
Effect: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. It cuts the target's HP to half.

Name: Superpower
Effect: The user attacks the target with great power. However it also lowers the user's Attack and Defense.

Name: Tackle
Effect: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.

Name: Tail Slap
Effect: The user attacks by striking the target with its hard tail. It hits the target two to five times in a row.

Name: Take Down
Effect: A reckless full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. It also damages the user a little.

Name: Thief
Effect: The user attacks and steals the target's held item simultaneously. It can't steal if the user holds an item.

Name: Thousand Arrows
Effect: This move also hits opposing Pokémon that are in the air. Those Pokémon are knocked down to the ground.

Name: Thousand Waves
Effect: The user attacks with a wave that crawls along the ground. Those hit can't flee from battle.

Name: Thrash
Effect: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. It then becomes confused however.

Name: Thunder Fang
Effect: The user bites with electrified fangs. It may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.

Name: Thunder Punch
Effect: The target is punched with an electrified fist. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Triple Kick
Effect: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each  successive hit.

Name: Twineedle
Effect: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. It may also poison the target.

Name: U-turn
Effect: After making its attack the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

Name: V-create
Effect: With a hot flame on its forehead the user hurls itself at its target. It lowers the user's Defense Sp. Def and Speed stats.

Name: Vice Grip
Effect: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.

Name: Vine Whip
Effect: The target is struck with slender whiplike vines to inflict damage.

Name: Vital Throw
Effect: The user attacks last. In return this throw move is guaranteed not to miss.

Name: Volt Tackle
Effect: The user electrifies itself then charges.  It causes considerable damage to the user and may leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Wake-Up Slap
Effect: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. It also wakes the target up however.

Name: Water Shuriken
Effect: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.

Name: Waterfall
Effect: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch. It can also be used to climb a waterfall.

Name: Wild Charge
Effect: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. It also damages the user a little.

Name: Wing Attack
Effect: The target is struck with large imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.

Name: Wood Hammer
Effect: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. The user also sustains serious damage.

Name: Wrap
Effect: A long body or vines are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.

Name: X-Scissor
Effect: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.

Name: Zen Headbutt
Effect: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Absorb
Effect: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Acid
Effect: The opposing team is attacked with a spray of harsh acid. The acid may also lower the targets' Sp. Def stats.

Name: Acid Spray
Effect: The user spits fluid that works to melt the target. This harshly reduces the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Aeroblast
Effect: A vortex of air is shot at the target to inflict damage. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Air Cutter
Effect: The user launches razor-like wind to slash the opposing team. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Air Slash
Effect: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Ancient Power
Effect: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. It may also raise all the user's stats at once.

Name: Aura Sphere
Effect: The user looses a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This move is certain to hit.

Name: Aurora Beam
Effect: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target's Attack stat.

Name: Belch
Effect: The user lets out a damaging belch on the target. The user must eat a Berry to use this move.

Name: Blast Burn
Effect: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user must rest on the next turn however.

Name: Blizzard
Effect: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike the opposing team. It may also freeze them solid.

Name: Blue Flare
Effect: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense yet beautiful blue flame. It may leave the target with a burn.

Name: Boomburst
Effect: The user attacks everything around it with the destructive power of a terrible explosive sound.

Name: Brine
Effect: If the target's HP is down to about half this attack will hit with double the power.

Name: Bubble
Effect: A spray of countless bubbles is jetted at the opposing team. It may also lower the targets' Speed stats.

Name: Bubble Beam
Effect: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the opposing team. It may also lower their Speed stats.

Name: Bug Buzz
Effect: The user vibrates its wings to generate a damaging sound wave. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Charge Beam
Effect: The user attacks with an electric charge. The user may use any remaining electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Chatter
Effect: The user attacks using a sound wave based on words it has learned. It may also confuse the target.

Name: Clear Smog
Effect: The user attacks by throwing a clump of special mud. All status changes are returned to normal.

Name: Confusion
Effect: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. It may also leave the target confused.

Name: Dark Pulse
Effect: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Dazzling Gleam
Effect: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.

Name: Disarming Voice
Effect: Letting out a charming cry the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.

Name: Discharge
Effect: A flare of electricity is loosed to strike the area around the user. It may also cause paralysis.

Name: Doom Desire
Effect: Two turns after this move is used the user blasts the target with a concentrated bundle of light.

Name: Draco Meteor
Effect: Comets are summoned down from the sky onto the target. The attack's recoil harshly reduces the user's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Dragon Breath
Effect: The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Dragon Pulse
Effect: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user's gaping mouth.

Name: Dragon Rage
Effect: This attack hits the target with a shock wave of pure rage. This attack always inflicts 40 HP damage.

Name: Draining Kiss
Effect: The user steals the target's energy with a kiss. The user's HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.

Name: Dream Eater
Effect: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. It absorbs half the damage caused to heal the user's HP.

Name: Earth Power
Effect: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

Name: Echoed Voice
Effect: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn it does greater damage.

Name: Electro Ball
Effect: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target the greater the damage.

Name: Electroweb
Effect: The user captures and attacks opposing Pokémon by using an electric net. It reduces the targets' Speed stat.

Name: Ember
Effect: The target is attacked with small flames. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Energy Ball
Effect: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

Name: Eruption
Effect: The user attacks the opposing team with explosive fury. The lower the user's HP the less powerful this attack becomes.

Name: Extrasensory
Effect: The user attacks with an odd unseeable power. It may also make the target flinch.

Name: Fairy Wind
Effect: The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target with it.

Name: Fiery Dance
Effect: Cloaked in flames the user dances and flaps its wings. It may also raise the user's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Final Gambit
Effect: The user risks everything to attack its target. The user faints but does damage equal to the user's HP.

Name: Fire Blast
Effect: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Fire Pledge
Effect: A column of fire hits opposing Pokémon. When used with its Grass equivalent its damage increases into a vast sea of fire.

Name: Fire Spin
Effect: The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex of fire that rages for four to five turns.

Name: Flame Burst
Effect: The user attacks the target with a bursting flame. The bursting flame damages Pokémon next to the target as well.

Name: Flamethrower
Effect: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Flash Cannon
Effect: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it at once. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Focus Blast
Effect: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

Name: Freeze-Dry
Effect: The user rapidly cools the target. This may also leave the target frozen. This move is super effective on Water types.

Name: Frenzy Plant
Effect: The user slams the target with an enormous tree. The user can't move on the next turn.

Name: Frost Breath
Effect: The user blows a cold breath on the target. This attack always results in a critical hit.

Name: Fusion Flare
Effect: The user brings down a giant flame. This attack does greater damage when influenced by an enormous thunderbolt.

Name: Future Sight
Effect: Two turns after this move is used a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.

Name: Giga Drain
Effect: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Glaciate
Effect: The user attacks by blowing freezing cold air at opposing Pokémon. This attack reduces the targets' Speed stat.

Name: Grass Knot
Effect: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target the greater the damage.

Name: Grass Pledge
Effect: A column of grass hits opposing Pokémon. When used with its water equivalent its damage increases into a vast swamp.

Name: Gust
Effect: A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched at the target to inflict damage.

Name: Heat Wave
Effect: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on the opposing team. It may also leave targets with a burn.

Name: Hex
Effect: This relentless attack does massive damage to a target affected by status problems.

Name: Hidden Power
Effect: A unique attack that varies in type depending on the Pokémon using it.

Name: Hurricane
Effect: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky. It may also confuse the target.

Name: Hydro Cannon
Effect: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user must rest on the next turn however.

Name: Hydro Pump
Effect: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.

Name: Hyper Beam
Effect: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user must rest on the next turn to regain its energy.

Name: Hyper Voice
Effect: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.

Name: Hyperspace Hole
Effect: Using a hyperspace hole the user appears right next to the target and strikes. This also hits a target using Protect or Detect.

Name: Ice Beam
Effect: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. It may also freeze the target solid.

Name: Ice Burn
Effect: On the second turn an ultracold freezing wind surrounds the target. This may leave the target with a burn.

Name: Icy Wind
Effect: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. It also reduces the targets' Speed stat.

Name: Incinerate
Effect: The user attacks opposing Pokemon with fire. If a Pokemon is holding a certain item such as a berry the item becomes burned up and unusable

Name: Inferno
Effect: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense fire. It leaves the target with a burn.

Name: Infestation
Effect: The target is infested and attacked for four to five turns. The target can't flee during this time.

Name: Judgment
Effect: The user releases countless shots of light at the target. Its type varies with the kind of Plate the user is holding.

Name: Lava Plume
Effect: An inferno of scarlet flames torches everything around the user. It may leave targets with a burn.

Name: Leaf Storm
Effect: The user whips up a storm of leaves around the target. The attack's recoil harshly reduces the user's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Leaf Tornado
Effect: The user attacks its target by encircling it in sharp leaves. This attack may also lower the target's accuracy.

Name: Light of Ruin
Effect: Drawing power from the Eternal Flower the user fires a powerful beam of light. This also damages the user quite a lot.

Name: Luster Purge
Effect: The user lets loose a damaging burst of light. It may also reduce the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Magical Leaf
Effect: The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack will not miss.

Name: Magma Storm
Effect: The target becomes trapped within a maelstrom of fire that rages for four to five turns.

Name: Mega Drain
Effect: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Mirror Coat
Effect: A retaliation move that counters any special attack inflicting double the damage taken.

Name: Mirror Shot
Effect: The user looses a flash of energy at the target from its polished body. It may also lower the target's accuracy.

Name: Mist Ball
Effect: A mistlike flurry of down envelops and damages the target. It may also lower the target's Sp. Atk.

Name: Moonblast
Effect: Borrowing the power of the moon the user attacks the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Mud Bomb
Effect: The user launches a hard-packed mud ball to attack. It may also lower the target's accuracy.

Name: Mud Shot
Effect: The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the target. It also reduces the target's Speed.

Name: Mud-Slap
Effect: The user hurls mud in the target's face to inflict damage and lower its accuracy.

Name: Muddy Water
Effect: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at the opposing team. It may also lower the targets' accuracy.

Name: Mystical Fire
Effect: The user attacks by breathing a special hot fire. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Night Daze
Effect: The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. It may also lower the target's accuracy.

Name: Night Shade
Effect: The user makes the target see a frightening mirage. It inflicts damage matching the user's level.

Name: Oblivion Wing
Effect: The user absorbs its target's HP. The user's HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.

Name: Octazooka
Effect: The user attacks by spraying ink in the target's face or eyes. It may also lower the target's accuracy.

Name: Ominous Wind
Effect: The user blasts the target with a gust of repulsive wind. It may also raise all the user's stats at once.

Name: Origin Pulse
Effect: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with countless beams of light that glow a deep and brilliant blue.

Name: Overheat
Effect: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack's recoil harshly reduces the user's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Parabolic Charge
Effect: The user attacks everything around it. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by those hit.

Name: Petal Dance
Effect: The user attacks the target by scattering petals for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.

Name: Powder Snow
Effect: The user attacks with a chilling gust of powdery snow. It may also freeze the targets.

Name: Power Gem
Effect: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.

Name: Psybeam
Effect: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. It may also cause confusion.

Name: Psychic
Effect: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. It may also reduce the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Psycho Boost
Effect: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack's recoil harshly reduces the user's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Psyshock
Effect: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.

Name: Psystrike
Effect: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.

Name: Psywave
Effect: The target is attacked with an odd  psychic wave. The attack varies in intensity.

Name: Razor Wind
Effect: A two-turn attack. Blades of wind hit opposing Pokémon on the second turn. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Relic Song
Effect: The user sings an ancient song and attacks by appealing to the hearts of those listening. It may also induce sleep.

Name: Roar of Time
Effect: The user blasts the target with power that distorts even time. The user must rest on the next turn.

Name: Round
Effect: The user attacks the target with a song. Others can join in the Round and make the attack do greater damage.

Name: Scald
Effect: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. It may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Searing Shot
Effect: An inferno of scarlet flames torches everything around the user. It may leave targets with a burn.

Name: Secret Sword
Effect: The user cuts with its long horn. The odd power contained in the horn does physical damage to the target.

Name: Seed Flare
Effect: The user emits a shock wave from its body to attack its target. It may harshly lower the target's Sp. Def.

Name: Shadow Ball
Effect: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Sheer Cold
Effect: The target is attacked with a blast of absolute-zero cold. The target instantly faints if it hits.

Name: Shock Wave
Effect: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack cannot be evaded.

Name: Signal Beam
Effect: The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. It may also confuse the target.

Name: Silver Wind
Effect: The target is attacked with powdery scales blown by wind. It may also raise all the user's stats.

Name: Sludge
Effect: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. It may also poison the target.

Name: Sludge Bomb
Effect: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. It may also poison the target.

Name: Sludge Wave
Effect: It swamps the area around the user with a giant sludge wave. It may also poison those hit.

Name: Smog
Effect: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. It may also poison the target.

Name: Snarl
Effect: The user yells as if it is ranting about something making the target's Sp. Atk stat decrease.

Name: Snore
Effect: An attack that can be used only if the user is asleep. The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.

Name: Solar Beam
Effect: A two-turn attack. The user gathers light then blasts a bundled beam on the second turn.

Name: Sonic Boom
Effect: The target is hit with a destructive shock wave that always inflicts 20 HP damage.

Name: Spacial Rend
Effect: The user tears the target along with the space around it. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Spit Up
Effect: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored the greater the damage.

Name: Steam Eruption
Effect: The user immerses the target in superheated steam. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Stored Power
Effect: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user's stats are raised the greater the damage.

Name: Struggle Bug
Effect: While resisting the user attacks the opposing Pokémon. The targets' Sp. Atk stat is reduced.

Name: Surf
Effect: It swamps the area around the user with a giant wave. It can also be used for crossing water.

Name: Swift
Effect: Star-shaped rays are shot at the opposing team. This attack never misses.

Name: Synchronoise
Effect: Using an odd shock wave the user inflicts damage on any Pokémon of the same type in the area around it.

Name: Techno Blast
Effect: The user fires a beam of light at its target. The type changes depending on the Drive the user holds.

Name: Thunder
Effect: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Thunder Shock
Effect: A jolt of electricity is hurled at the target to inflict damage. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Thunderbolt
Effect: A strong electric blast is loosed at the target. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Tri Attack
Effect: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. May also burn freeze or leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Trump Card
Effect: The fewer PP this move has the greater its attack power.

Name: Twister
Effect: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at the opposing team. It may also make targets flinch.

Name: Uproar
Effect: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. Over that time no one can fall asleep.

Name: Vacuum Wave
Effect: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.

Name: Venoshock
Effect: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. Its power is doubled if the target is poisoned.

Name: Volt Switch
Effect: After making its attack the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

Name: Water Gun
Effect: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.

Name: Water Pledge
Effect: A column of water strikes the target. When combined with its fire equivalent the damage increases and a rainbow appears.

Name: Water Pulse
Effect: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. It may also confuse the target.

Name: Water Spout
Effect: The user spouts water to damage the opposing team. The lower the user's HP the less powerful it becomes.

Name: Weather Ball
Effect: An attack move that varies in power and type depending on the weather.

Name: Whirlpool
Effect: Traps foes in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.

Name: Wring Out
Effect: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has the greater this attack's power.

Name: Zap Cannon
Effect: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.

Name: Acid Armor
Effect: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself sharply raising its Defense stat.

Name: Acupressure
Effect: The user applies pressure to stress points sharply boosting one of its stats.

Name: After You
Effect: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.

Name: Agility
Effect: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. It sharply boosts the Speed stat.

Name: Ally Switch
Effect: The user teleports using a strange power and switches its place with one of its allies.

Name: Amnesia
Effect: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. It sharply raises the user's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Aqua Ring
Effect: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP on every turn.

Name: Aromatherapy
Effect: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status problems affecting the user's party.

Name: Aromatic Mist
Effect: The user raises the Sp. Def stat of ally Pokémon with a mysterious aroma.

Name: Assist
Effect: The user hurriedly and randomly uses a move among those known by other Pokémon in the party.

Name: Attract
Effect: If it is the opposite gender of the user the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.

Name: Autotomize
Effect: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raise its Speed stat.

Name: Baby-Doll Eyes
Effect: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes which lowers its Attack stat. This move always goes first.

Name: Barrier
Effect: The user throws up a sturdy wall that sharply raises its Defense stat.

Name: Baton Pass
Effect: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting passing along any stat changes.

Name: Belly Drum
Effect: The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for HP equal to half its max HP.

Name: Bestow
Effect: The user passes its held item to the target when the target isn't holding an item.

Name: Block
Effect: The user blocks the target's way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.

Name: Bulk Up
Effect: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body boosting both its Attack and Defense stats.

Name: Calm Mind
Effect: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

Name: Camouflage
Effect: The user's type is changed depending on its environment such as at water's edge in grass or in a cave.

Name: Captivate
Effect: If it is the opposite gender of the user the target is charmed into harshly lowering its Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Celebrate
Effect: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day!

Name: Charge
Effect: The user boosts the power of the Electric move it uses on the next turn. It also raises the user's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Charm
Effect: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly making it less wary. The target's Attack is harshly lowered.

Name: Coil
Effect: The user coils up and concentrates. This raises its Attack and Defense stats as well as its accuracy.

Name: Confide
Effect: The user tells the target a secret and the target loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Confuse Ray
Effect: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.

Name: Conversion
Effect: The user changes its type to become the same type as the move at the top of the list of moves it knows.

Name: Conversion 2
Effect: The user changes its type to make itself resistant to the type of the attack the opponent used last.

Name: Copycat
Effect: The user mimics the move used immediately before it. The move fails if no other move has been used yet.

Name: Cosmic Power
Effect: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

Name: Cotton Guard
Effect: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton drastically raising the user's Defense stat.

Name: Cotton Spore
Effect: The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to the target harshly reducing its Speed stat.

Name: Crafty Shield
Effect: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. This does not stop moves that do damage.

Name: Curse
Effect: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.

Name: Dark Void
Effect: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.

Name: Defend Order
Effect: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

Name: Defense Curl
Effect: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.

Name: Defog
Effect: A strong wind blows away the target's obstacles such as Reflect or Light Screen. It also lowers the target's evasiveness.

Name: Destiny Bond
Effect: When this move is used if the user faints the Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints.

Name: Detect
Effect: It enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

Name: Disable
Effect: For four turns this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.

Name: Double Team
Effect: By moving rapidly the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

Name: Dragon Dance
Effect: The user vigorously performs a mystic powerful dance that boosts its Attack and Speed stats.

Name: Eerie Impulse
Effect: The user's body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Electric Terrain
Effect: The user electrifies the ground under everyone's feet for five turns.  Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.

Name: Electrify
Effect: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn the target's move becomes Electric type.

Name: Embargo
Effect: It prevents the target from using its held item. Its Trainer is also prevented from using items on it.

Name: Encore
Effect: The user compels the target to keep using only the move it last used for three turns.

Name: Endure
Effect: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

Name: Entrainment
Effect: The user dances with an odd rhythm that compels the target to mimic it making the target's Ability the same as the user's.

Name: Fairy Lock
Effect: By locking down the battlefield the user keeps all Pokémon from fleeing during the next turn.

Name: Fake Tears
Effect: The user feigns crying to fluster the target harshly lowering its Sp. Def stat.

Name: Feather Dance
Effect: The user covers the target's body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.

Name: Flash
Effect: The user flashes a bright light that cuts the target's accuracy. It can also be used to illuminate caves.

Name: Flatter
Effect: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However it also raises the target's Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Flower Shield
Effect: The user raises the Defense stat of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle with a mysterious power.

Name: Focus Energy
Effect: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.

Name: Follow Me
Effect: The user draws attention to itself making all targets take aim only at the user.

Name: Foresight
Effect: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. It also enables an evasive target to be hit.

Name: Forest's Curse
Effect: The user puts a forest curse on the target. Afflicted targets are now Grass type as well.

Name: Gastro Acid
Effect: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target's Ability.

Name: Geomancy
Effect: The user absorbs energy and sharply raises its Sp. Atk Sp. Def and Speed stats on the next turn.

Name: Glare
Effect: The user intimidates the target with the pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.

Name: Grass Whistle
Effect: The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.

Name: Grassy Terrain
Effect: The user turns the ground under everyone's feet to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of Pokémon on the ground a little every turn.

Name: Gravity
Effect: Gravity is intensified for five turns making moves involving flying unusable and negating Levitate.

Name: Growl
Effect: The user growls in an endearing way making the opposing team less wary. The foes' Attack stats are lowered.

Name: Growth
Effect: The user's body grows all at once raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

Name: Grudge
Effect: If the user faints the user's grudge fully depletes the PP of the opponent's move that knocked it out.

Name: Guard Split
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to average its Defense and Sp. Def stats with those of its target's.

Name: Guard Swap
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Defense and Sp. Def with the target.

Name: Hail
Effect: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except the Ice type.

Name: Happy Hour
Effect: Using Happy Hour doubles the amount of Prize Money received after battle.

Name: Harden
Effect: The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise its Defense stat.

Name: Haze
Effect: The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.

Name: Heal Bell
Effect: The user makes a soothing bell chime to heal the status problems of all the party Pokémon.

Name: Heal Block
Effect: For five turns the user prevents the opposing team from using any moves Abilities or held items that recover HP.

Name: Heal Order
Effect: The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.

Name: Heal Pulse
Effect: The user emits a healing pulse which restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP.

Name: Healing Wish
Effect: The user faints. In return the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status cured.

Name: Heart Swap
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.

Name: Helping Hand
Effect: The user assists an ally by boosting the power of its attack.

Name: Hold Hands
Effect: Ally Pokémon hold hands. This makes them very happy.

Name: Hone Claws
Effect: The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat and accuracy.

Name: Howl
Effect: The user howls loudly to raise its spirit boosting its Attack stat.

Name: Hypnosis
Effect: The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the target fall into a deep sleep.

Name: Imprison
Effect: If the opponents know any move also known by the user the opponents are prevented from using it.

Name: Ingrain
Effect: The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn. Because it is rooted it can't switch out.

Name: Ion Deluge
Effect: The user disperses electrically charged particles which changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.

Name: Iron Defense
Effect: The user hardens its body's surface like iron sharply raising its Defense stat.

Name: Kinesis
Effect: The user distracts the target by bending a spoon. It lowers the target's accuracy.

Name: King's Shield
Effect: The user takes a defensive stance while it protects itself from damage. It also harshly lowers the Attack stat of any attacker who makes direct contact.

Name: Leech Seed
Effect: A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.

Name: Leer
Effect: The opposing team gains an intimidating leer with sharp eyes. The opposing team's Defense stats are reduced.

Name: Light Screen
Effect: A wondrous wall of light is put up to suppress damage from special attacks for five turns.

Name: Lock-On
Effect: The user takes sure aim at the target. It ensures the next attack does not fail to hit the target.

Name: Lovely Kiss
Effect: With a scary face the user tries to force a kiss on the target. If it succeeds the target falls asleep.

Name: Lucky Chant
Effect: The user chants an incantation toward the sky preventing opposing Pokémon from landing critical hits.

Name: Lunar Dance
Effect: The user faints. In return the Pokémon taking its place will have its status and HP fully restored.

Name: Magic Coat
Effect: A barrier reflects back to the target moves like Leech Seed and moves that damage status.

Name: Magic Room
Effect: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon's held items lose their effects for five turns.

Name: Magnet Rise
Effect: The user levitates using electrically generated magnetism for five turns.

Name: Magnetic Flux
Effect: The user manipulates magnetic fields which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

Name: Mat Block
Effect: Using a pulled-up mat as a shield the user protects itself and its allies from damaging moves. This does not stop status moves.

Name: Me First
Effect: The user tries to cut ahead of the target to steal and use the target's intended move with greater power.

Name: Mean Look
Effect: The user pins the target with a dark arresting look. The target becomes unable to flee.

Name: Meditate
Effect: The user meditates to awaken the power deep within its body and raise its Attack stat.

Name: Memento
Effect: The user faints when using this move. In return it harshly lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk.

Name: Metal Sound
Effect: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly reduces the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: Metronome
Effect: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain into randomly using nearly any move.

Name: Milk Drink
Effect: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its maximum HP. May also be used in the field to heal HP.

Name: Mimic
Effect: The user copies the target's last move. The move can be used during battle until the Pokémon is switched out.

Name: Mind Reader
Effect: The user senses the target's movements with its mind to ensure its next attack does not miss the target.

Name: Minimize
Effect: The user compresses its body to make itself look smaller which sharply raises its evasiveness.

Name: Miracle Eye
Effect: Enables a Dark-type target to be hit by Psychic-type attacks. It also enables an evasive target to be hit.

Name: Mirror Move
Effect: The user counters the target by mimicking the target's last move.

Name: Mist
Effect: The user cloaks its body with a white mist that prevents any of its stats from being cut for five turns.

Name: Misty Terrain
Effect: The user covers the ground under everyone's feet with mist for five turns. This protects Pokémon on the ground from status conditions.

Name: Moonlight
Effect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

Name: Morning Sun
Effect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

Name: Mud Sport
Effect: The user covers itself with mud. It weakens Electric-type moves for five turns.

Name: Nasty Plot
Effect: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. It sharply raises the user's Sp. Atk.

Name: Nature Power
Effect: An attack that makes use of nature's power. Its effects vary depending on the user's environment.

Name: Nightmare
Effect: A sleeping target sees a nightmare that inflicts some damage every turn.

Name: Noble Roar
Effect: Letting out a noble roar the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

Name: Odor Sleuth
Effect: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit with Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. It also enables an evasive target to be hit.

Name: Pain Split
Effect: The user adds its HP to the target's HP then equally shares the combined HP with the target.

Name: Parting Shot
Effect: With a parting threat the user lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats. Then it switches with a party Pokémon.

Name: Perish Song
Effect: Any Pokémon that hears this song faints in three turns unless it switches out of battle.

Name: Play Nice
Effect: The user and the target become friends and the target loses its will to fight. This lowers the target's Attack stat.

Name: Poison Gas
Effect: A cloud of poison gas is sprayed in the face of opposing Pokémon. It may poison those hit.

Name: Poison Powder
Effect: The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust on the target. It may poison the target.

Name: Powder
Effect: The user covers the target in a powder that explodes and damages the target if it uses a Fire-type move.

Name: Power Split
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to average its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with those of the target's.

Name: Power Swap
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk with the target.

Name: Power Trick
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack with its Defense stat.

Name: Protect
Effect: It enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

Name: Psych Up
Effect: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.

Name: Psycho Shift
Effect: Using its psychic power of suggestion the user transfers its status problems to the target.

Name: Quash
Effect: The user suppresses the target and makes its move go last.

Name: Quick Guard
Effect: The user protects itself and its allies from priority moves. If used in succession its chance of failing rises.

Name: Quiver Dance
Effect: The user lightly performs a beautiful mystic dance. It boosts the user's Sp. Atk Sp. Def and Speed stats.

Name: Rage Powder
Effect: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opponents aim only at the user.

Name: Rain Dance
Effect: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns powering up Water-type moves.

Name: Recover
Effect: Restoring its own cells the user restores its own HP by half of its max HP.

Name: Recycle
Effect: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.

Name: Reflect
Effect: A wondrous wall of light is put up to suppress damage from physical attacks for five turns.

Name: Reflect Type
Effect: The user reflects the target's type making it the same type as the target.

Name: Refresh
Effect: The user rests to cure itself of a poisoning burn or paralysis.

Name: Rest
Effect: The user goes to sleep for two turns. It fully restores the user's HP and heals any status problem.

Name: Roar
Effect: The target is scared off and replaced by another Pokémon in its party. In the wild the battle ends.

Name: Rock Polish
Effect: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. It can sharply raise the Speed stat.

Name: Role Play
Effect: The user mimics the target completely copying the target's natural Ability.

Name: Roost
Effect: The user lands and rests its body. It restores the user's HP by up to half of its max HP.

Name: Rototiller
Effect: Tilling the soil the user makes it easier for plants to grow. This raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of Grass-type Pokémon.

Name: Safeguard
Effect: The user creates a protective field that prevents status problems for five turns.

Name: Sand Attack
Effect: Sand is hurled in the target's face reducing its accuracy.

Name: Sandstorm
Effect: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all combatants except the Rock Ground and Steel types.

Name: Scary Face
Effect: The user frightens the target with a scary face to harshly reduce its Speed stat.

Name: Screech
Effect: An earsplitting screech harshly reduces the target's Defense stat.

Name: Sharpen
Effect: The user reduces its polygon count to make itself more jagged raising the Attack stat.

Name: Shell Smash
Effect: The user breaks its shell lowering its Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply raising Attack Sp. Atk and Speed stats.

Name: Shift Gear
Effect: The user rotates its gears raising its Attack and sharply raising its Speed.

Name: Simple Beam
Effect: The user's mysterious psychic wave changes the target's Ability to Simple.

Name: Sing
Effect: A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming voice that puts the target into a deep slumber.

Name: Sketch
Effect: It enables the user to permanently learn the move last used by the target. Once used Sketch disappears.

Name: Skill Swap
Effect: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.

Name: Slack Off
Effect: The user slacks off restoring its own HP by up to half of its maximum HP.

Name: Sleep Powder
Effect: The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.

Name: Sleep Talk
Effect: While it is asleep the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.

Name: Smokescreen
Effect: The user releases an obscuring cloud of smoke or ink. It reduces the target's accuracy.

Name: Snatch
Effect: The user steals the effects of any healing or stat-changing move the opponent attempts to use.

Name: Soak
Effect: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target's type to Water.

Name: Soft-Boiled
Effect: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its maximum HP. May also be used in the field to heal HP.

Name: Spider Web
Effect: The user ensnares the target with thin gooey silk so it can't flee from battle.

Name: Spikes
Effect: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team's feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.

Name: Spiky Shield
Effect: In addition to protecting the user from attacks this move also damages any attacker who makes direct contact.

Name: Spite
Effect: The user unleashes its grudge on the move last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.

Name: Splash
Effect: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...

Name: Spore
Effect: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.

Name: Stealth Rock
Effect: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opponent's team. The trap hurts opponents that switch into battle.

Name: Sticky Web
Effect: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team which lowers their Speed stat upon switching into battle.

Name: Stockpile
Effect: The user charges up power and raises both its Defense and Sp. Def. The move can be used three times.

Name: String Shot
Effect: The targets are bound with silk blown from the user's mouth. This silk reduces the targets' Speed stat.

Name: Stun Spore
Effect: The user scatters a cloud of paralyzing powder. It may leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Substitute
Effect: The user makes a copy of itself using some of its HP. The copy serves as the user's decoy.

Name: Sunny Day
Effect: The user intensifies the sun for five turns powering up Fire-type moves.

Name: Supersonic
Effect: The user generates odd sound waves from its body. It may confuse the target.

Name: Swagger
Effect: The user enrages and confuses the target. However it also sharply raises the target's Attack stat.

Name: Swallow
Effect: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to heal its HP. Storing more power heals more HP.

Name: Sweet Kiss
Effect: The user kisses the target with a sweet angelic cuteness that causes confusion.

Name: Sweet Scent
Effect: A sweet scent that harshly lowers the opposing team's evasiveness. It also lures wild Pokémon if used in grass etc.

Name: Switcheroo
Effect: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.

Name: Swords Dance
Effect: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. It sharply raises the user's Attack stat.

Name: Synthesis
Effect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

Name: Tail Glow
Effect: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Tail Whip
Effect: The user wags its tail cutely making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stat.

Name: Tailwind
Effect: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed of all party Pokémon for four turns.

Name: Taunt
Effect: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

Name: Teeter Dance
Effect: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.

Name: Telekinesis
Effect: The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.

Name: Teleport
Effect: Use it to flee from any wild Pokémon. It can also warp to the last Pokémon Center visited.

Name: Thunder Wave
Effect: A weak electric charge is launched at the target. It causes paralysis if it hits.

Name: Tickle
Effect: The user tickles the target into laughing reducing its Attack and Defense stats.

Name: Topsy-Turvy
Effect: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.

Name: Torment
Effect: The user torments and enrages the target making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.

Name: Toxic
Effect: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.

Name: Toxic Spikes
Effect: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the opponent's feet. They poison opponents that switch into battle.

Name: Transform
Effect: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.

Name: Trick
Effect: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.

Name: Trick Room
Effect: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.

Name: Trick-or-Treat
Effect: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target's type.

Name: Venom Drench
Effect: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack Sp. Atk and Speed stats of a poisoned target.

Name: Water Sport
Effect: The user soaks itself with water. The move weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.

Name: Whirlwind
Effect: The target is blown away to be replaced by another Pokémon in its party. In the wild the battle ends.

Name: Wide Guard
Effect: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn. If used in succession its chance of failing rises.

Name: Will-O-Wisp
Effect: The user shoots a sinister bluish-white flame at the target to inflict a burn.

Name: Wish
Effect: One turn after this move is used the target's HP is restored by half the user's maximum HP.

Name: Withdraw
Effect: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell raising its Defense stat.

Name: Wonder Room
Effect: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.

Name: Work Up
Effect: The user is roused and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.

Name: Worry Seed
Effect: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making its Ability Insomnia.

Name: Yawn
Effect: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
